SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbortedGameMessage
This message is sent from the server to connected clients when a connection error between a client and the server occurs
AbortedMessageHandler
This message handler manages the reception of an Aborted Game message, sent when, due to connectivity issues, a client disconnects.
AccessResultMessage
This message is sent to a client after it successfully joins or creates a game(success), or after the access is denied as the game is full(failure).
AlreadyStartedView
This view is displayed when a player tries to join a game which has already started
BadlyFormattedParametersException
This exception is thrown when a command has badly formatted parameters
BeginningOfTurnMessage
This message is sent to all logged in players and represents the beginning of a new turn.
BeginningOfTurnMessageHandler
Handles the reception of the message representing the beginning of the turn of some user
Board
This class contains elements and methods which can manipulate the board.
BoardCell
This class represent a single cell of the board.
BoardCellEnum
This enumeration contains status of cells.
BoardView
The BoardView manages the printing of the board.
CardBuilder
This class contains static methods that can be used to mass produce different types of cards.
Cell
This class represents a single cell of the shell and the board.
ChatCommandHandler
The handler for the chat command
ChatMessage
A chat message the sender username, the string that the sender wants to send (body), the list of users that should receive the message and the time at which the message is sent, which is automatically generated by the system.
ChatMessageHandler
Handles the reception and the creation of chat messages.
ChatView
The chat view is accessed when the user wants to display chat messages.
CheckShelfPortionResult
Object representing the result of checking a portion of a player shelf for a common goal card pattern
Cli
This class is the CLI of the game.
CliCommandException
This object represents a generic command exception generated by the cli
CliCommandHandler
These type of classes handles the validation of a command inserted in the cli by the user, based on the parameters and the current game phase.
CliCommandResponse
Marker interface for the objects that can be returned from a CliCommandHandler ( A CliView to change or a Message to be sent to the server )
ClientConnection
Abstract class representing the server-side state of a client connected to the server.
ClientMain
The client-side entry point of the game.
ClientManager
The ClientManager acts as a controller layer above the UserInterface.
ClientNetworkHandler
The client network handler is responsible for the server-client interactions.
ClientPhasesEnum
All the phases the client goes through during a game.
ClientState
A class which represents a state of the client.
CLIMessages
This class contains messages used to inform the player during the game (for cli).
CliView
Interface describing a generic view of the text user interface
CommandNotAvailableInThisPhaseException
This exception is thrown when the requested command is not available in a particular phase
CommandPicker
The command picker is a thread that constantly scans System.in waiting for a command.
CommonGoalCard
CommonGoalCards represents a goal for all players.
CommonGoalCardsView
The common goal card view displays all the common goal cards with the relative points.
ConnectionEstablishedMessage
A ConnectionEstablished message is sent to a client when a connection between the client and the server is established and the client can proceed with the login operations.
ConnectionModesEnum
The two possible ways of interacting with the server: SOCKET or RMI
Constants
This class contains useful values
Coordinates
A pair of numbers representing the coordinates of a grid
Creator
A Message creator is a MessageHandler class that implements the methods to create a Message object given the requested set of parameters.
CsvToBoardParser
This class contains utility methods for parsing csv files describing what are defined as board cell type configuration: the csv contains the type of each cell in the board board object card configuration: the csv contains the Object cards in the board
CsvToShelfParser
Object containing methods that parse a CSV representation of a shelf
DiagonalBoardCellsCellsPickException
Thrown when a player is trying to pick tiles which don't share either the column or the row
EmptyBoardCellsPickException
Thrown when a player is trying to pick a tile from an empty cell
EmptySackException
Thrown when the sack is empty and the board is being refilled
EndGameAdjacencyGoalChecker
This class contains the methods used to calculate the points that can be earned by inserting adjacent object cars into the shelf.
EndGameResultsView
This view displays the name of the winner of the game and the points made by each player
EndOfGameCard
The end of game card is the card that's assigned when the game enters its final round.
EndOfGameHandler
Handles the reception of the message representing the end of the game
EndOfGameMessage
This message signals the end of the game and contains information regarding the recently finished game.
EndOfTurnMessage
This message signals the end of a turn and contains information regarding the recently finished turn.
EndOfTurnMessageHandler
Handles the reception of the message representing the end of the turn by the active player
FixedPatternCommonGoalCard
Since most of the CommonGoalCards share the same logic to detect a pattern because of the same rules applied to a repeated (or not) fixed shaped Pattern, this class contains all the implementation to the pattern matching algorithm.
Cards of this type are loaded during runtime from a json file.
FixedPatternShapedCard
Marker interface This interface indicates that the Goal card implementation represents one or more repetition of the same fixed pattern, so the pattern matching algorithms will behave according to this common fact.
FoundSavedGameMessage
This message is sent to the admin of the game as a notification that a game is saved.
FoundSavedGameMessageHandler
This handler manages the reception of a FoundSavedGameMessage, so that the admin of the lobby can c
FoundSavedGameResponseMessage
This message is sent from the client as a response to the request of reloading a new game, and it contains a response result, which may be positive or negative.
FreePatternShapedCard
Marker interface This interface indicates that the Goal card implementation represents one or more repetition of a free shaped pattern, so the pattern matching algorithms will be implemented ad hoc for the card.
Game
The main game class.
GameAbortedView
The aborted game view is rendered when the game is aborted (because a client has lost connection or because the server is no longer online)
GameCheckout
This class contains the points made by every player and the winner of the game
GameController
The GameController is the controller of the game: it keeps an instance of the game, interacting with it when messages are received and receiving notifications when some situations are met.
GameInfo
This class contains useful information about the game it can be accessed from.
GameObjectConverter
This class implements methods that help converting complex objects into their simplified description.
GameSceneController
Interface for game phases scene controllers.
GameStartMessage
This message is broadcast to every player and contains information regarding the various game elements: the representation of the clientBoard, the shelves, the common and personal goal cards, the ordered list of players.
GameStartMessageHandler
Handles the reception of the message representing all the objects required for the view in the beginning of a game.
GameStatusEnum
This enumeration contains the possible states in which the game may be
GoalCard
A Goal Card contains a pattern which players aim to reproduce in their shelf in order to gain points.
GoalCardsDeckSingleton
This class is effectively a deck of cards.
Gui
This class is the Gui of the game.
HelpCommandHandler
This object handles the help command, and calls the render of the help view
HelpView
The help view is used to present the user all the usable commands.
IllegalBoardCellsPickException
Thrown when an illegal cell pick is submitted
IllegalShelfActionException
Generic exception regarding a move made on the shelf that does not comply with the rules
JoinGameCommandHandler
Cli command to join the game after a successful login
JoinGameMessage
A join game message is sent by a client when it wants to join the game.
JoinGameMessageHandler
Handles the creation and the reception of the messages relative to the game lobby joining.
JsonFixedPatternGoalCardsParser
A class to load FixedPatternShapedCards in memory from a json file (so every PersonalGoalCard and most of CommonGoalCards)
LobbyView
The lobby view is used to draw the game lobby before the start of the game
Logger
This helper class implements static methods that log on the standard output a required message
LoginCommandHandler
Object that handles the login command execution
LoginMessageHandler
Handles the creation and the reception of the messages relative to the login requests and responses.
LoginRequestMessage
A login request is a message sent to the server by a client that wants to log in with a username.
LoginResponseMessage
A login response is sent after a login request is received, and indicates that the login failed or happened with success.
LoginResult
This object refers to the possible results of the login of a client.
LoginView
The login view is used to prompt the user to log into the server with a username
MatrixUtils
This class contains useful methods for displaying and manipulating a matrix
MaxPlayersException
Thrown when a player is trying to access a game that is full
MediaManager
This object contains all the resources that are useful for the gui.
Message
A message is the object that is sent between clients and the server through the network, and it contains information about moves done by the players, about communication logistics (login of a client, disconnection, ping), and about the state of the game.
MessageHandlersUtils
Check if the result to a requested action message is "SUCCESS"
MessagesHandler
Marking interface implemented by classes which handles the creation of messages to dispatch to server and the update of the client state based on the incoming Message objects from server.
MessageType
The message type enumeration contains all the possible type headers of messages that are recognized by the system and exchanged in the system.
MessageWithResult
This interface represents messages that contain the result to a requested action
MultipleShelvesView
This view displays the shelf of each player
NetworkConfigurationData
Class that retrieves information regarding the network-related configuration of the client ( socket of the server and rmi interface) by either reading an apposite file or by requesting the user to insert network data
NewPlayerJoinedMessageHandler
Handles the reception of the message relative to the joining of a new player in the lobby.
NewPlayerMessage
The new player message contains the username of a newly joined player and is broadcast to all the players who've already joined.
NoEmptyAdjacentBoardCellsPickException
Thrown when a move is trying to pick tiles which don't have at least a free side
NoSpaceEnoughInShelfColumnException
Thrown when it's impossible to add tiles to a particular column of the shelf as there's no more space
NoSpaceEnoughInShelfException
Thrown when tiles can't be added to a shelf as there's not enough space left
NotAdmittedMessage
When the queue of players waiting to join a lobby is too big, say of size N, and there are only M available places, this message is sent to the last N-M players who are not admitted to the game
NotAdmittedMessageHandler
This object handles the receiving of a NotAdmittedMessage
NotAdmittedView
This view is displayed when a player is not admitted to a game after waiting in queue
NotJoinedView
This view is showed for a brief period of time, after the user has logged in but isn't in a lobby yet.
NotYetImplementedException
Exceptions that is thrown when a functionality is not yet implemented
NumberOfPlayersSelectionMessage
This message is sent by the client as a response to the PickNumberOfPlayers message.
ObjectCard
This class describes the object cards.
ObjectTypeEnum
Possible types of Object Cards.
Pattern
A pattern object describes a sub-matrix of the shelf which is used as a mask during the pattern matching.
PatternCell
A Pattern Cell represents a covered cell in a Pattern, with a set of coordinates relative to the Pattern frame and the admittedType.
PersonalGoalCard
A PersonalGoalCard represents a shelf configuration to match by the card owner.
PersonalGoalCardView
This view is used to show the personal goal cards of a player
PickChecker
This object contains methods that check whether different types of selections follow the rules of the game.
PickFromBoardCommandHandler
This object handles the pick from board command, by executing a check regarding the inserted coordinates and by sending a message to the server if the check is successful
PickFromBoardMessage
This message is sent by the player that's active during a given turn, and contains a list of coordinates that correspond to object cards in the game board.
PickFromBoardMessageHandler
Handles the creation and the reception of messages used in the picking from board phase during the user's turn.
PickFromBoardPhase
The phase in which the player chooses the coordinates of the object cards that he wants to pick from the board.
PickFromBoardResultMessage
This message is sent to the client as a validation of the PickFromBoardMessage.
PickFromBoardView
The pick from board view displays a prompt to the user reminding it to pick a tile from the board.
PickNumberOfPlayersMessage
This message is sent when a client tries to join a game that doesn't exist yet: the client becomes the admin and creator of the game, and has to decide the number of player the game will have.
PickPlayersView
This view is used to prompt the player who's creating the lobby to insert the wanted number of players.
Pinger
The pinger is a thread that's invoked by the server as soon as it starts.
PingMessageHandler
Handles the creation and the reception of Ping messages sent between client and server.
PingRequestMessage
This message is sent to each client by the server.
Player
This class contains main player info and methods which manipulate points and shelf.
PlayerAchievements
This class contains a player's achievements
PlayersNumberCommandHandler
This handler manages the selection of the number of players: if the number is acceptable a message is sent to the server
PlayersNumberSelectionMessageHandler
Handles the creation and the reception of the message relative to the player number selection by the admin user.
PointCard
The specific point card awarded by a common goal card when completed
PointEnumeration
The points awarded by a point card
PointsView
This view is used to show the points made by each player
Printer
This class implements methods and contains attributes useful for printing game objects and messages in the text interface.
PropsChangesNotifier<T>
Checks for the differences between the attributes of two instances of the same class and notifies the "PropertyChangeListeners"
PutInShelfPhase
The phase in which the player chooses a column of his shelf in which to put the previously chosen object cards (that were taken from the board)
QuitCommandHandler
This handler manages the exit of a player from the game
Reducer
A Reducer is a MessageHandler that implements the client state update logic.
ReloadDecisionView
This view is used to ask the admin of the lobby to decide to reload a game or not when a saved game is found and the users match.
ReloadGameChoice
This enumeration contains the two possible results of the request of the loading of an already started game
ReloadGameCommandHandler
This handler manages the decision of reloading a saved game when found.
Renderer
This class contains methods that render gui elements.
ResponseResultType
A response result can be either a success or a failure.
ResponsesDescriptions
This class contains different messages descriptions.
RMIClient
The RMI Client is a client that uses the RMI (Remote Method Invocation) technology to communicate with the game server.
RMIClientConnection
Class that inherits from ClientConnection, shaped for RMI connections: the client interface is kept in order to correctly call each client.
RMIClientInterface
This interface contains methods that the server uses to invoke the client via RMI
RMIServer
The RMI server. it can be called by each client.
RMIServerInterface
The remote interface of the server the client uses to invoke methods on the remote object.
Sack
The sack class contains all the object cards and is populated when initSack() is called.
SaveFileData
This object contains all the information needed to completely store the state of a running game on the disk.
SaveFileManager
This object contains methods that save and load a game state to and from disk
Scene1LoginController
Controller for login scene.
Scene2LobbyCreationController
Controller for lobby creation scene
Scene2WaitingForLobbyController
Controller for waiting for lobby scene
Scene3LoadGameController
Controller for load game scene
Scene3LobbyController
Controller for lobby scene
Scene4BoardSceneController
Controller for board scene
Scene4SelectColumnController
Controller for select column scene
Scene4WaitingController
Controller for waiting scene
Scene5FinalResultsController
Controller for final results scene
SceneAlreadyStartedController
Controller for already started scene
SceneController
The interface of scene controllers.
SceneGameAbortedController
Controller for game aborted scene
SceneNotAdmittedController
Controller for the not admitted game scene
SceneWithChatController
Interface for scene controllers with chat.
SelectColumnCommandHandler
This handler manages the command regarding the selection of the column after tiles are picked from the board
SelectColumnMessage
This message represents the choice of the shelf column in which to put the cards picked from the board.
SelectColumnMessageHandler
Handles the creation and the reception of messages used in the selection of a column during the user's turn.
SelectColumnResultMessage
This message contains the result of the choice of the shelf column coming from the user.
SelectColumnView
This view shows the player its own shelf and displays a message requesting the insertion of the column in which to put the picked cards
ServerConfigurationData
Object containing the configuration of the server, taken from the serverConfig json in src/config.
ServerNetworkHandler
The network handler contains the instance of a socket server and of a rmi server: it has methods that regard the general client-server interaction, both towards the server and towards the client.
ServerStart
ServerStart
Shelf
This class contains a player's shelf status and manipulates it with some methods.
ShelfCell
A specialization of Cell, regarding the cells of a shelf
ShelfView
This view displays the shelf of the player.
ShowViewCommandHandler
A showViewCommandHandler parses a /show command and performs the modification of the view.
SimplifiedCommonGoalCard
A simplified version of a common Goal card, consisting only in id and list of point cards
SimplifiedGameInfo
A SimplifiedGameInfo instance contains a copy of the game info object that can be found in game.
SimplifiedPlayer
A simplified description of the player.
SnakesCommonGoalCard
This class describes the goalCard that requires the building of 4 separated groups of four adjacent ObjectCards of the same type.
XCXXX XCCCX XABBB AAXXB AXAXX AAAXX Where A,B,C are an ObjectCard of different types and X is an empty space
SocketClient
The implementation of the network-side of the client used for socket-based communication
SocketClientConnection
This class is used by the server to communicate with a client via a particular connection
SocketReceiver
Class containing a thread that receives messages to from the server through sockets, used to permit parallel sending and receiving of messages by the client.
SocketSender
Class containing a thread that sends messages to the web through sockets, used to permit parallel sending and receiving of messages by the client.
SocketServer
The socket server.
StateContainer
A StateContainer is an object which holds the application's state, which can be acquired or updated through the apposite StateContainer supplied methods.
TurnPhase
TurnPhase is an abstraction of every phase of the turn.
UIModesEnum
The two implemented types of user interface
UserInterface
Interface of the view.
WaitForLobbyMessage
This message is sent to every client who logged while a player is deciding the number of players that should participate in the game
WaitForLobbyMessageHandler
This handler manages the receiving of a Wait for lobby message by setting the phase of the client to WAITING FOR LOBBY
WaitingForLobbyView
This view is shown to logged in player who haven't joined a lobby yet as it's being created.
WaitingForTurnView
This view is shown to each player when it's not their turn to play.
WrongNumberOfPlayersException
Thrown when, while trying to build or manage a game, a non rule compliant number of players is set
WrongPointCardsValueGivenException
Thrown when trying to set a non rule compliant number of points to a common goal card
